Key Arguments: The legislation is unnecessary as existing laws already address speech crimes like defamation and inciting violence.
The bill could be used to shut down lawful discussions on social issues.
The bill's primary purpose appears to be the suppression of political beliefs contrary to mainstream views.
The threat of large fines to private companies will lead to excessive censorship.
The definitions of harm in the bill are vague and subjective, potentially leading to misuse.
There is a lack of trust in leadership to use the bill justly without proper safeguards.
Notable Quotes: The necessity of this legislation is certainly questionable when speech crimes such as defamation and inciting violence are already outlawed.
The bill’s primary purpose seems to be the eradication of political beliefs deemed contrary to the mainstream.
The definitions contained in the draft bill are also outrageously vague and subjective.
The hope that this bill will be used only for good – when it can so easily be used for unjust censorship – I think is naïve.
